intro: Roettlera paucinervia, commonly known as the narrow-veined roettlera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Roettlera paucinervia is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
